comment: Dr. Khalid is the man! If you are at all interested in aerospace you don't want to miss his classes. You will be amazed simply by the breadth of knowledge that he has. The lectures were recorded because of COVID but he is always available for questions and explanations. The coursework is tough, but he grades fairly. Excellent Professor!

Awesome! Took Professor Khalid for the aero minor classes. He is very good at what he does. Extremely knowledgeable. You will have to work hard in his classes but it's worth it. I learned so much! Lots of homework, project in each class, and tests are challenging. He usually curves at the end. Overall, so glad I took class with him. 100% recommend

Dr. Khalid is a wonderful professor, but Helicopter Theory is a beast of a class. Pay attention to the lectures and take notes. The tests were challenging but definitely manageable. Do yourself a favor and start your homework early. This goes triple for the group project. Good class, especially if you like aerospace and aren't afraid of work.

Dr. Khalid is a fantastic professor! Aircraft Propulsion may be my favorite class that I've taken in my entire degree. The material can be somewhat challenging at first but Dr. Khalid is always available to help if you ask him. 2 tests, 7 hw, quizzes on Friday, and a group project (start early). Grades very fairly. Good luck!

He is one of the best prof. that i have take in few courses with for Aerospace minor. The homework does take few hours to do and you need to pay attention in his lectures to do good on test, Hw & group project. Responds quickly and Answers any question you have.

The class was graded on one test, weekly pop quizzes, and a semester long group project. Professor Khalid was always available outside of class if we needed it and the quizzes and test were very reasonable. The project was to design an aircraft using the concepts learned in class and took a lot of work but was overall a good experience.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Khalid is passionate and knowledgeable about what he teaches. Class is difficult because Aerospace Engineering is difficult. He has real life examples each class and is a good professor if you're interested in Aerospace.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Do you want to take a math involved class without a single teaching? Make sure take the class with him. Read your own book and turn in homework. Who is the professor doesn't seem to be important.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is a great instructor in my opinion. I've had him for a few classes now and I feel like he thoroughly explains concepts and works through multiple examples of each type of problem. Expect at least 5 hours of a homework each week. You will learn in this class if you show up ready

The HWs take a long time to figure out since the textbook is not very helpful for many of the book problems (go figure), & after you turn them in there's no solutions posted. 1 exam which was really intense & a group project that takes a lot of time to do (more than my senior capstone did). Weekly pop quizzes. Curve is certainly applied however.

Great professor. You have to do some outside work to finish home work and projects but it prepares you for the real world. Gives good feedback but likes for you to find a solution yourself. As long as you take notes and study, you will pass

Stochastic decision modeling concepts aren't the easiest to grasp to begin with. To add to that, his teaching style isn't helpful and A LOT of outside study and practice is required to even hope to do well. Can easily be a very tough grader when he wants to, but if you're lucky he will give straight-forward open notes tests you can do well on.
